title: Deep Learning-Based Soil Sampling Location Optimization Process

context.prior_knowledge: Soil science fundamentals, basic statistical analysis experience, and understanding of deep learning (image processing/neural networks)
context.additional_context: Designing field-applicable models using multidimensional data (Aspect, Flow Accumulation, Slope, NDVI, Yield) collected from actual agricultural settings

learning_goals: Learners can preprocess input datasets for a deep learning model using five soil property data types, including NDVI and Slope.
Learners can design a model to predict optimal sampling locations using a CNN/Transformer-based encoder-decoder architecture.
Data augmentation techniques can be applied to address the imbalanced dataset problem (sample points vs. background pixels).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
